definitions.definition: a fixed luminous point in the night sky that is a large, remote incandescent body like the sun.
examples: celestial body, heavenly body, sun; Moreasteroid, planet, dwarf planet "the sky was full of stars"Moreasteroid, planet, dwarf planet the sky was full of stars

definitions.definition: a conventional or stylized representation of a star, typically one having five or more points.
examples: the walls were painted with silver moons and stars

definitions.definition: a star symbol used to indicate a category of excellence.
a white patch on the forehead of a horse or other animal.
a data or communication network in which all nodes are independently connected to one central unit.
examples: noun: star network; plural noun: star networks

definitions.definition: a famous or exceptionally talented performer in the world of entertainment or sports.
synonyms: heroine More"the stars of the film"celebrity
megastar "a star of the world of chess"

definitions.definition: an outstandingly good or successful person or thing in a group.
examples: a rising star in the party

definitions.definition: a planet, constellation, or configuration regarded as influencing someone's fortunes or personality.
examples: his golf destiny was written in the stars

definitions.definition: a horoscope published in a newspaper or magazine.
(of a movie, play, or other show) have (someone) as a principal performer.
(of a performer) have a principal role in a movie, play, or other show.
examples: McQueen had starred in such epics as The Magnificent Seven

definitions.definition: (of a person) perform brilliantly or prominently in a particular endeavor or event.
examples: Vitt starred at third base for the Detroit Tigers

definitions.definition: decorate or cover with star-shaped marks or objects.
mark (something) for special notice or recommendation with an asterisk or other star-shaped symbol.
examples: the activities listed below are starred according to their fitness ratings
